page.title: 05SHIRLEY CORNER SCHOOL.
page.content: Shirley Corner school was built in 1887 and is situated on top of the hill by the garage, on the Crediton road. On the first day of the school opening lots of children came but only one child was let in, because of the infant age limit. On the next day three more children were admitted. After a couple of days the Governers decided to change the age limit and all ages of children were allowed in. The toilets were built across the playground. During the war many evacuees came to the school. By the 1970s the school was very overcrowded, and they had to use the Chapel rooms for some children. Eventually a new school was opened on 4th July, 1975, called Copplestone County Primary School, and Shirley Corner school was closed.
